newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan, US, Germany study joint forex action - Kyodo.
newsitem.headline: Japan, US, Germany study joint forex action - Kyodo.

text.p: Japan, the United States and Germany are exploring the possibility of joint intervention in the foreign exchange markets to sell dollars for yen, Kyodo News Agency quoted an international monetary source as saying on Wednesday.
A Bank of Japan official declined to comment on the report.

The move follows an accord reached in Washington last week by the Group of Seven (G7) leading industrialized nations signalling that they would cooperate in the currency markets to prevent a further rise in the dollar, Kyodo quoted the source as saying.
Japan's Finance Minister Hiroshi Mitsuzuka has said that Japan will deal decisively with excessive weakness of the yen.
